clinical_study.brief_title: Measure of Engagement of Epilepsy Patients in Messaging Groups
clinical_study.official_title: Measure of Engagement of Epilepsy Patients in Messaging Groups and Group Characteristics That Influence Engagement.

lead_sponsor.agency: Royal Free Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.source: Royal Free Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

brief_summary.textblock: This study will measure the engagement of people with epilepsy in a mobile phone based messaging platform as well as understand if there is an impact on their self-management

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary purpose of this study is to assess a person with epilepsy's level of usage of a mobile messaging application for peer support. The secondary purpose is to understand what characteristics of their group drive different levels of usage and improvements in self-management.
Participants can participate as much or little as they want for a minimum of six weeks. Participants will complete an initial and a final questionnaire.

primary_outcome.description: Average participant number of posts over time frame assessed by tracking number of participant entries

secondary_outcome.description: Patient activation measure based on self-reported questionnaire
Medication adherence based on self-reported questionnaire
Quality of life in epilepsy metric based on self-reported questionnaire

arm_group.description: The Experimental Group will be placed in a group using the matching algorithm. Facilitator support and education intervention

intervention.description: Group engaged with facilitator support and education

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age, diagnosis of epilepsy, have access to a smartphone capable of running messaging application
Exclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of learning disability/difficulty, significant mental health conditionsÍ¾ those in care, bereaved, or prisoners. Any other vulnerable individuals (individuals unable to protect themselves against significant harm or exploitation)
